key_points: Brad Jones named interim president and CEO of ERCOT, replacing Bill Magness.
Jones previously worked in senior roles at ERCOT and was president of New York's power grid operator.
Magness was fired following a deadly winter storm in February that resulted in widespread power outages.
The storm led to more than 100 deaths and left millions without power amid freezing temperatures.
ERCOT and the Public Utility Commission of Texas faced criticism for their handling of the storm.
ERCOT's fall projections underestimated the maximum power demand and overestimated available power generation for severe winter conditions.
Lt. Gov. Dan Patrick called for the resignations of Magness and DeAnn Walker, head of the PUC.
Gov. Greg Abbott has called for reforms in ERCOT's governance.
Lawmakers are facing pressure to pass legislation to prevent future power failures.
Texas is likely to experience a hotter and drier summer than normal, increasing demands on the power grid.
